channel.description: Recent content in migration on CAMGDP

item.title: Sources: International Organization for Migration
item.description:
IOM presence in Uzbekistan began in 2003. In 2019, Uzbekistan officially became a member-state of the IOM. The organization was officially accredited in April 2021.

There are currently no reports or country-specific research conducted by the IOM in Uzbekistan.

item.title: Sources: UN Women Data Hub
item.description:
Publications on the UN Women Data Hub have an option to filter by region. Eurasia and Central Asia region primarily focuses on Eastern European and Balkan countries with occasional inclusion of Central Asia.

Themes of publications include data use, disabilities, economic empowerment, ending violence against women, environment, gender and COVID-19, HIV and AIDS, migration, sustainable development, and peace and security.

item.title: Sources: International Organization for Migration
item.description:
The International Organization for Migration publishes reports on migration issues in Kazakhstan.

Data is usually presented in gendered format splitting respondents between male and female. Methodological note and information on data collection are not available. Reports are available in English, Kazakh, and Russian.

item.title: Sources:
item.description: Public Opinion Research Institute is a Kazakhstani sociological institute specializes in public opinion, marketing, and sociological studies of Kazakhstan and other countries. The institute publishes research reports on various topics, including COVID-19, migration, social values, etc. Most publications are available in Kazakh and Russian with occasional translation to English.
